channel.title: getting started on Stencil
channel.description: Recent content in getting started on Stencil

item.title: Get Started
item.description: If this is your first time using Stencil and you’ve already installed Stencil on your machine, we recommend the quick start.

item.title: Quick Start
item.description: This quick start uses macOS in the examples. For instructions about how to install Stencil on other operating systems, see install. It is required to have Git installed to run this tutorial. Step 1: Install Stencil Step 2: Create a New Site mkdir <repo> stencil create templaterepository github.com/<org>/<repo> The above will create a new stencil template repository in the current directory Step 3: Add some new files Step 4: Use the template repository

item.title: Install Stencil
item.description: There is lots of talk about “Stencil being written in Go”, but you don’t need to install Go to enjoy Stencil. Just grab a precompiled binary! Stencil is written in Go with support for multiple platforms. The latest release can be found at Stencil Releases. Stencil currently provides pre-built binaries for the following: macOS (Darwin) for x64, i386, and ARM architectures Windows Linux Stencil may also be compiled from source wherever the Go toolchain can run; e.
